availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Clark (Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer. )

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, blacksmith and farmer. Union County, Kentucky, native. Married to Lovis Womack Clark in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on November 29, 1855. Father of Saraphine Clark and James O. Clark. Blacksmith in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 127B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 541.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 1.
"James Madison Clark (1828-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial #45844461, accessed January 4, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/45844461.
